summary: The "Pick Up After Your DOGE Act" mandates audits of federal agency computer systems accessed by the United States DOGE Service and associated agency teams. It requires the Administrator of the United States DOGE Service to report on agency system access and tasks the Comptroller General with comprehensive audits, prioritizing systems of the Social Security Administration, HHS, CMS, Treasury, and IRS. The Comptroller General will submit audit reports with recommendations, and agencies must address identified vulnerabilities and report on their fix.
